data.title: Miranda Raison: British Actress, Movies & TV Shows, Age, Spouse, Net Worth, WikI!
data.meta_description: Miranda Raison's versatile career includes notable roles in "Spooks" and "Match Point," along with acclaimed stage performances, cementing her status in acting.
data.text:
Miranda Raison is a versatile actress known for her performances on both stage and screen. Born on November 18, 1977, in Burnham Thorpe, Norfolk, England, she has made significant contributions to the entertainment industry.

With breakthrough roles in television series like “Spooks” (also known as “MI-5”) and appearances in notable films such as “Match Point,” Raison has garnered widespread acclaim for her talent and versatility. Her dedication to her craft, coupled with her captivating presence, has solidified her status as a prominent figure in the world of acting.

Miranda Raison Early Life

Miranda Raison was born on November 18, 1977, in Burnham Thorpe, Norfolk, England. Her parents are Caroline and Nick Raison. They divorced when she was five years old.

Miranda Raison Education

Raison trained at the Webber Douglas Academy of Dramatic Art to pursue her acting career.

Miranda Raison Family

Miranda Raison comes from a family with ties to the entertainment industry. Her mother, Caroline, worked as a newsreader for Anglia Television, while her father, Nick Raison, was a jazz pianist.

Miranda Raison Zodiac Sign

Miranda Raison’s zodiac sign is Scorpio, as she was born on November 18.

Miranda Raison Relationship Status

Miranda Raison was previously married to actor Raza Jaffrey. They later divorced.

Miranda Raison Career

Miranda Raison’s career spans across both stage and screen, showcasing her versatility and talent as an actress. She gained prominence with her breakthrough role in the BBC series “Spooks” (also known as “MI-5”), where she portrayed a compelling character. Raison has also made notable appearances in films like “Match Point,” directed by Woody Allen.

Her contributions to the entertainment industry extend beyond television and film, as she has showcased her acting prowess on stage, including starring roles in productions such as the title role in “Anne Boleyn” at Shakespeare’s Globe. With her diverse range of performances, Raison continues to captivate audiences and establish herself as a respected figure in the world of acting.
